Reviews.Title: “A GOOD HOTEL AND GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: vaya k
Reviews.Content: Good hotel on a quiet street. Very close to metro station Lepando (3 minutes) and near to Vatican City (12 minutes). Away from ordes of tourists but close to many monuments either on feet or by metro. Modern decorated room, small (even the triple) for a family with a child, but clean. Adequate breakfast, with a variety of sweets, snaks, coffees and juices (not natural). Polite staff, but not so helpful as I wanted. Lack of maps and helpful information and brochures in the front desk and in the room. There wasn't late check out and that was a burden for us, as our flight was scheduled for 20.00'. Anyway, 240 Euros per night, (B/B) even for this 4star hotel, is a high price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MonsterBabes
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Metropolis Hotel in Rome. it's about 18 months old, so everything is still new and fresh. We were very comfortable in the hotel. It has a great bed, and a clean, modern bathroom. The free wifi was very temperamental, and gave lots of hassles, but we managed to get through from time to time. That was the only negative of our stay. The hotel breakfast was pretty good. A wide variey from yoghurt and fruit to eggs and bacon. We enjoyed having something different to the usual European breakfast of pastries / cold meat / cheese only. It's a 5 minute walk from the nearest metro station, Lepanto, which makes it convenient for getting around, and about 20 mins walk from the Vatican (although you can catch the underground to a slightly closer stop). Getting there from the Termini station took us about 45 minutes in total, once we had walked through the termini station from where the trains are. That was a little unexpected, but very manageable. If you're not up for walking with your bags, then better to take a taxi. I would recommend this hotel. One word of caution: be very very careful when choosing where to eat. Get a recommendation from someone. We didn't have one nice meal in Italy. Most restaurants are tourist traps, poor quality, very expensive and generally awful. We also managed to get food poisoning from a pizza at one of those "self service" joints. Stay well clear of them!!

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed - terrible location”
Reviews.Author: sara e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolis for our honeymoon and we were unimpressed. The internet did not work in our work (which is how we usually choose our restaurants) and the staff was unapologetic and not very helpful. The hotel is also not located near any of the main points of interest in Rome nor does it have any good restaurants in the vicinity. We ended up eating at the hotel's restaurant one night, after a long day of walking--the food was good (all the food we had in Italy was) but not particularly amazing. We would have preferred to be closer to the main sites for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Failed to impress”
Reviews.Author: Simtravel_12
Reviews.Content: Rome was the final pit-stop of my Italy tour to celebrate my birthday. I chose this hotel as it was close to Vatican City and I wanted a bit of luxury to make up for the previous 2 stars hotels I stayed in. The room I was allocated on arrival had no bath tub - after 4 days on the road this was a must. After much persuasion I was moved to a new room. The bar and restaurant was small and offered limited variety. Room Service menu was just as bad - 3 items max. It was clean and comfortable but by no far the upscale boutique hotel it claims. p.s. not so much as a bowl of fruit or card wishing me a happy birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Standard and functional”
Reviews.Author: stefanier918
Reviews.Content: Pictures are a bit deceiving. The lobby is very nice and modern. Rooms are starting to show wear and tear. Certain staff members were very helpful, others didn't think about going out of their way to help. Our room was small, even by European standards. We stayed for 3 nights (couple + friend, late 20's). It wasn't warm enough for the AC, so we had to open the window. Temperature wise this was ok...noise wise not ok. We were up all night between planes, trains, automobiles, and drunk people. Others in the hotel also complained about this. Bathroom was functional and well-stocked. Room was cleaned daily. We had breakfast, which was very good but crowded in the small "restaurant." We didn't eat off the limited menu as there are too many local establishments to try. Wi-fi never really worked, good thing it's free. The computer in the lobby worked well though. Close proximity to Lepanto metro stop (2 blocks). 15-20 minute walk to Vatican. This is a pretty residential area; not packed with tourists. For the price you can't beat it, but if this isn't at the top of your price range then go further in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jackee T
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 3 nights. The welcome was warm and friendly and the service was excellent. The rooms were beautifully decorated and excellently cleaned. Breakfast was good and included a small cooked breakfast, which was unexpected. I cannot fault the staff on their friendliness and willingness to help especially the wonderful Eros, who could not do enough for us. The hotel is only 100 metres or so from the Metro and the area was quiet. Overall a fantastic hotel

Reviews.Title: “A nice looking hotel close to the Metro.”
Reviews.Author: Gus H
Reviews.Content: A nice "design" hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The breakfast buffet was good with plenty of choices and the free Wi-Fi was easy to use. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood (bonus). One block from the Metro and 2 stops from the Spanish Step. The hotel is an excellent value with little effort involving the Metro. My only complain is that the bed was too hard for my taste but that seems to be typical of European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Manner of Staff ought to improve”
Reviews.Author: AndrewM32
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights with a group of friends in the end of January. The hotel was clean and modern. The location is not ideal for tourists but is very close to the Metro stop (one block walk). The continental breakfast and free wifi (not always working) were a plus. The unpleasant thing we have got is one of our groups was given a room for disabled in the evening we arrived. The morning, unfortunate perhaps it was a Saturday, when my friend requested for a change, they were refused. Many reasons could have been given and understood. But the reason given was that the staff had to report to her director. When asked to speak to the director she answered that her director was on holiday. When questioned whether this was an excuse, the staff said she would call the police. This is exceptional manner. When we (group of some 7 or 8 people) said we would talk to our tourist agent, the staff only until then called someone and agreed to change the room. The staff explained that she was just listening to orders. The room was changed and found satisfactory. But the manners in which a group of such numbers of tourists staying for 3 nights really make me feel whether the staff was authorised and if so whether the management (I assume the staff was talking to her boss) knew what they were doing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toddie1982
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Stayed in suite. Good size and spa bath in room. Metro 2 minute walk away and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: TO2
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days, very good location. 20 minutes walk to downtown and 5 minutes to vatican. There is a bus stop right in front of hotel that takes you downtown as well but we walked everywhere. The one day we decided to take it they were on strike, and since they apparently go on strike often i think it is not a good idea to get your accommodation far from what you like to see and rely on public transit unless you like to use the cab. The hotel is a boutique style hotel, medium to small size rooms but perfect for 2 people. Very clean, helpful and friendly staff. Excellent warm and cold breakfast buffet but never stayed there for lunch or dinner. Nothing really to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican, Clean & modern”
Reviews.Author: Mark_25_25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern with a little bit of old world charm. The location is not ideal for tourists but is very convenient to Metro stop (1 block walk). The continental breakfast and free wifi were a big plus considering there are a lot of places that want to charge extra for these services. I have been to Rome two different occasions and I feel that there are better restaurants in the vicinity to this hotel then to the more touristy areas. For instance, there are 2 sushi restaurants near Castel St. Angelo which is a short walk or only one metro stop away from hotel. Hotel staff was adequate and accommodating but, as I have found common in Italy, not much for conversation. I would not consider them rude but rather I think they are customarily just different.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lucyqua
Reviews.Content: Staff were very very friendly and efficient. I understand the hotel is new, so everything looks clean and crisp. Breakfast was good for Continental standards. In the lobby, the hotel provides 2 large sofa beds for the comfort of early arrivals waiting to be checked in or for guests who have evening flights! The hotel is located in a leafy street in a quiet residential area on the other side of the river, that is, off the tourist track. This is a minus, but at the same time it means you are out of the hustle and bustle of Rome's Centro Storico. The area is well served by public transport, including the Metro (Red Line, Lepanto Station, one block away) which takes you directly to the Spanish Steps and the Central Railway Station. Turning left out of the hotel into Via Giuseppe Ferrari, we found a good Trattoria, catering for locals, where we had good food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: A few months ago, booked a triple room in this hotel, superior room, three separate beds. After arrival we got a room without a window (hole in the roof rather not be called a window) with one double and one single bed . They completely ignored my comments at the reception. The next day during a conversation with a manager I got know from that this room is exactly what I booked that mesans as standard superior. I showed him pictures of rooms from the internet and then I heard that "these are just pictures." I could not believe such insolence, we changed hotel the same day, at the same price and also 4 star, but a much better standard.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Vasco1975
Reviews.Content: The best service, accomodation and style in town. Absolutely perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for Business, better for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: SZavahir
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel for a business trip and were planning to have meetings with our international colleagues. We unfortunately, had to cancel the plans at the last minute to have our meetings, and instead had smaller sessions with the colleagues that travelled. The room that they organised was not suitable to a business meeting or meeting clients as we originally wanted to. Also, the hotel did not refund us, even though we were told that we gave ample notice to cancel and it was not like the hotel was used for other meetings. I would not recommend this as a venue for business people who are planning to meet clients as the hotel does not have facilities. However, it was very close to the Vatican and a major shopping street which was great for holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Bottom line - Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sccoppa
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! This hotel was much more than we could have imagined. Our 'family room' was exactly as displayed on the website - clean and smelled great! The free wifi was good. The breakfast is amazing - hot and cold foods like scrambled eggs, meats, cheeses, cerals, breads.... and oh those criossants!!! Miguel at the front desk was great; friendly and helpful in either English or Italian. The hotel is less than a 10 minute walk to the Vatican, less than 5 minutes to food shops along Via Lepanto (South) and situtated close to many sites. Complaints: one - the Metro was too close so we couldn't walk by the pizza/sandwich/gelato shops!! This will be our hotel of choice on our next visit to Rome!! Thank you Hotel Metropilos for a great visit in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Will cancel your booking & Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: CanadiaBiz-traveller
Reviews.Content: WATCH OUT: THEY OVERBOOK THEIR HOTEL AND WILL CANCEL YOUR BOOKING IF THEY CAN RE-RENT IT OUT AT A HIGHER RATE TO LAST MINUTE CUSTOMERS WITH NO APOLOGIES. I had booked this hotel 2 months in advance and confirmed it. A week before my trip they email me with a generic email saying 'credit card processing/validity did not go through' and they promptly cancelled my booking without even bothering to find out why or if i could give them an alternate card/payment type. I called frantically, for 3 days before my trip and the manager, front desk and reservation office ('Francesco') kept bouncing me around asking me to call on Saturday, or after 15 minutes or when no one is in or would not speak to me or just hanged up. I got lucky on the third day and they took my alternate credit car number and said they will take 24 hours to get back to me....unbelievable, this is by a guy sitting in front of a computer in the hotels own booking office. Anyway, they write an email the next day (36 hours before my travel) that 'I have cancelled my own booking' and thank me for my interest in booking them previously?????? If not paying entire amount upfront on EXPEDIA/TRAVELOCITY ETC, STAY AWAY FROM DIRECT BOOKING. THIS IS A VERY SHADY PLACE. Anyway, the funniest thing is, i subsequently called my credit card company and they confirmed that no transaction by such hotel had even been run on my card and i promptly used the card to book a good hotel elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: carcheria
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at Metropolis Hotel. Excellent location, as we walked to the Vatican on our first day and took Metro to Forum and Coliseum on the second day and walked back to the hotel after touring the city sites. Had some trouble with the Wifi working on a perimeter room on the 4th floor, but the staff resolved it with a change of rooms and it worked well. There were not a lot of restaurants in the immediate area, but wandering around, we did find two excellent neighborhood places on Via Giuseppe Ferrari. Rooms were small, but immaculate and completely updated with contemporary decor, with room safes, large enough for lap tops. Excellent bathroom with rain shower. Beds were on the hard side, but again, that seemed to be the norm in Italy. Breakfast was very good, with large varied selection and polite and courteous staff. Staff was helpful with directions and ordering a private car to airport for us. Would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, nice location, quiet n clean, a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: kouliko
Reviews.Content: Professional services, very clean (sometimes a moisture or closure smell in the room but not disturbing), everyday room making, nice breakfast (but just breakfast - there's not a restorant cuisine for lunch or dinner, just some kind og cheese an ham varieties). Nice location - without underground people - just one block (200m) from metro station lepanto and 400m from tebere river. Close enough to vatican (1 metro stop), piazza del poppolo (1 metro stop), spagna - spanish steps (2 metro stops), trevi n via veneto (3 metro stops) - but its better to walk through if you can afford this. generally rome is a walking city and very friendly to pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-Tate
Reviews.Content: very very good location (very close to metro station), very clean rooms but not so roomy , good variety in breakfast, value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unfriendly staff and mini room”
Reviews.Author: Vavatubby
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very practical, walking distance (10 min) from Vatican and located 5 min from the metro. Very quiet at night, which is great for sleeping but no so good if you want to eat close to the hotel, because there are not many restaurants. The design of the hotel is very modern and pretty, the building is old and it makes a great contrast with the modern interior. Our room was nicely decorated but very, very small: there was barely any space to move around. As we stayed there for 6 rainy November days, it was difficult to put up with. The bathroom was very small, too and had a "saloon" glass door, that is to say: no lock, and no privacy whatsoever,... Even if advertised as having international TV channel, there was only a French news channel and BBC world. All the other ones were Italian. When my husband told the reception about it, he was answered very agressively that "You are in Italy, there is not many foreign channels". A very positive thing, however is the great buffet served for breakfast. Fresh and with a variety of food, including lovely Italian cakes . the cakes were different every day, which was really pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: susissima
Reviews.Content: it's an excellent hotel, no complaints about it. Very nice room on the 4th floor (= top floor), beautiful bathroom with rain shower. Excellent breakfast till 10.30 (and they keep on filling the buffet till that moment): i loved the fresh fruit salad. Staff is very competent and friendly. It's very close to the metro Station of Lepanto but because of construction work on the C line the metro only runs till 9 PM (except on Saturday), but there are busses. Reaching Trastevere is nog that easy (combination of bus and tram) or you have to feel like making a one hour walk ... Residential and very clean and quiet neighbourhood, not as filthy or noisy as other areas in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: mdbwr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a 3 day trip to Rome. It is about a 20 minute walk to the Vatican and about 10 minute walk to the Metro underground rail system. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. Most of them spoke English and were helpful with directions around the city. The rooms were beautiful and clean. Much bigger according to European standards. We booked the suite with the jacuzzi and was not disappointed. After a long day walking it hit the spot! The breakfast in the morning was really good. Fresh fruits, eggs, toast and cereal. Plus all the normal meats and cheeses. Great cappuccinos too. The only negative is that the carpets are cleaned using a strong detergent and the odor was very strong to breathe and got all over our 9month old as she was crawling around on the floor. We opened windows to air it out and put blankets on the floor for her and that seemed to tone it down. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My new Favorite Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tappa
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel for one night in Rome and it was fantastic, they could not find our reservation for 20 minutes, but did finally find it and the Manager gave us an upgrade for the delay and confusion to a suite. There were three staying in the room, which was beautiful and clean, only negative was the bathroom is very funky and when one person uses the bathroom and turns on the light it lights up the whole glass wall, very cool, except if the other person or persons are still sleeping, would recomend for a couple not three sharing. Location was excellent beautiful tree lined street and easy to walk to the Vatican, shopping or catch a cab, Loved this Hotel! Great decor and nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Zazou68
Reviews.Content: Good hotel: breakfast, room, room service & situation not far from the city (20 minutes by foot) . Breakfast: enough to begin a beautifull journey at Rome. The most difficult tourist people will say that it was not enough. For us it was just what we needed: different kind of bread, salty & sweet ingredients...cheese, ham, sauciges, patatoes... The rooms: we choosed for a small room, very nice, modern & clean. But be carreful, ask a room NOT ON THE STREET. We met american people who asked to change the room because they couldn't sleep at night. The rooms on the back are very quiet. You can eat at the hotel at nigt, very very good food. Services: not friendly except 2 ladies. But you don't stay at the hotel, so it's ok. But you will quickly see that the people in Rome are really not friendly, it's just incredible. We were very desapointed. The city is amazing, beautifull and clean but the people GRRRRRRR... definitly not nice. So the service at the hotel is just like everywhere in Rome . If you want to go at the Vatican museum, try to by your ticket al ready on internet other wise you will wait more than 4 hours before entrance. The hotel is not far from the old city but far enough to go back there at the evening, assurely if you are tired. So stay as long as you can in the old city, eat there and go back at the hotel lately. But once again, Rome is fantastic & the hotel is great. Isabelle & Vincent

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: pdiamond85
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a bit out of the center, but with a lot of walking the location is manageable. Now the terrible part- the bathroom had a sewer smell to it the whole time. I asked over and over for this to be looked into and fixed. I don't know if it was ever actually looked into, but no one at the front desk seemed to care and it was never fixed and it was disgusting. I felt like they cared nothing about me- they were rude and short

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good..”
Reviews.Author: kaivotie6
Reviews.Content: What was good: Very friendly staff, thanks again. Always a clean room, thanks even more. Free WIFI, worked almost every day. Style!. Short walk to Vatican. A good Trattoria just around the corner. Shopping streets near Vatican. Not so good: Our room was next to the elevator and a loud radio was playing all night long, so not much sleep there... Also street noise was very loud till 3:00am, but our room was on the street side of the building. Not so much of a privacy in the room toilet as the door is a like saloon door... Not many of Roman taxi-drivers know the location of this new hotel. We liked our first stay in Rome and will be back! Hotel may vary...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulesFrazer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very stylish and contemporary. Imaculate and clean, seems very new and kitted out with the best modern technology. The bedroom was great only downside is it was quite small. Also when you first see it from the outside it doesn't look great, but don't worry once inside it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: AngelNana
Reviews.Content: we had sch a great time at this hotel! we took a family deluxe room with the jacuzzi....i must say...the jacuzzi was VERY useful after a day of walking and sight-seeing! when we first arrived, they told us that someone canceled our booking and put us into 2 rooms....a twin room and a double room.... they apologized so much and didn't make us pay any extra costs! they then moved us to the original room we booked, the family deluxe room.... all the rooms are VERY modern, very modern design and amenities.... the bathroom is amazing....the shower had amazing pressure and easily adjustable water temperature... each room had at least one plasma TV and the lighting was amazing...... now the service in the hotel is outstanding! Linda...the receptionist is an unbelievable help! she gave us so much advice on where to go and where to eat and how to get there! and the kitchen staff are so nice! especially Danielle....he is so helpful! and the bell-boys where so nice too! the hotel is perfectly situated! the metro stop is a 1 min walk away and there are around 5 bus stops around the hotel... the neighborhood is so quite and homey you would never feel homesick! there is also a supermarket just 2 turns away from the hotel.... we got around mostly by walking, but we also found the metro and bus VERY helpful! especially when we where exhausted! the bus would drop us right infront of the door of the hotel! the breakfast isn't very versatile but it was still really good! they try to change a few things every day! all in all...best hotel ever! :)

HotelInfo.Name: Metropolis Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via delle Milizie, 26, 00195 Rome, Italy
